devdoc.author: Sunny Radadiya

returns._0: The underlying balance of asset tokens

params.redeemAmount: The amount of `token()` to withdraw.  Denominated in `token()` as above.

returns._0: The actual amount of tokens that were redeemed.

sponsor(uint256).details: This allows anyone to distribute tokens among the share holders

params.amount: The amount of tokens to deposit

params.mintAmount: The amount of `token()` to be supplied
params.to: The user whose balance will receive the tokens

devdoc.title: An pooltogether yield source for Idle token

IdleYieldSourceInitialized(address).notice: Emitted when the yield source is initialized

RedeemedToken(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted when asset tokens are redeemed from the yield source

Sponsored(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when asset tokens are supplied to sponsor the yield source

SuppliedTokenTo(address,uint256,uint256,.notice: Emitted when asset tokens are supplied to the yield source

TransferredERC20(address,address,uint256.notice: Emitted when ERC20 tokens other than yield source's aToken are withdrawn from the yield source

balanceOfToken(address).notice: Returns the total balance (in asset tokens).  This includes the deposits and interest.

depositToken().notice: Returns the ERC20 asset token used for deposits.

initialize(address).notice: Initializes the yield source with Idle Token

redeemToken(uint256).notice: Redeems tokens from the yield source from the msg.sender, it burn yield bearing tokens and return token to the sender.

sponsor(uint256).notice: Allows someone to deposit into the yield source without receiving any shares

supplyTokenTo(uint256,address).notice: Allows assets to be supplied on other user's behalf using the `to` param.
